actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Education, Arts, Humanities.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Education, Arts and Humanities

official_title: A bill to expand funding for successful dropout prevention and reentry programs and to coordinate and improve Federal programs addressing the Nation's dropout program, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Dropout Programs Improvement Act of 1991 - Amends the School Dropout Demonstration Assistance Act of 1988 to extend the authorization of appropriations for assistance to address school dropout problems. Authorizes additional appropriations for the Secretary of Education to award grants to local educational agencies in each State to replicate the most successful programs assisted under such Act. Amends the Department of Education Organization Act of 1979 to increase by one (from four to five) the number of specified additional officers in the Department of Education who are to be appointed to carry out certain functions. Adds to such functions: (1) the evaluation, coordination, and dissemination of dropout prevention and reentry programs administered by the Department as well as federally funded dropout programs administered outside the Department; and (2) assistance in directing applicants to appropriate grant funding possibilities for local dropout prevention and reentry programs.

titles.title: A bill to expand funding for successful dropout prevention and reentry programs and to coordinate and improve Federal programs addressing the Nation's dropout program, and for other purposes.
